content: The Act may be cited as the "Cord Blood Stem Cell Act of 2003". The Congress finds that research has shown the feasibility of using cord blood for clinical applications, including bone marrow reconstitution for certain diseases. Cord blood, obtained from the placenta and umbilical cord, can be used for bone marrow reconstitution in recipients with malignancies, genetic disorders, and acquired diseases.
